In 'Graduation Day,' a mysterious man descends from the sky and manifests in a sports car and targets a local violent road- racing gang of motor heads, headed by a ruthless bully who'll do anything to get what he wants. In 'The Relic,' a homicide detective and an anthropologist try to destroy a South American lizard- like god, who' s on a people eating rampage in a Chicago museum. This movie will give you an idea of what can happen when trying to stop something that is very dangerous.

In both movies, the main characters are trying their best to protect others from harm.

conversation.text:
I would recommend Grindhouse for its exploration of exploitation and double features in the 60s and 70s. It's also a great introduction to Quentin Tarantino's unique blend of exploitation, violence, and humor.

For those who prefer a more traditional romance story, Why Did I Get Married? may be a better fit. This film follows the trials of marriage and explores what happens to one family when a sexy young temptress arrives on the scene. It's also a great introduction to Richard T. Jones' unique blend of drama, humor, and sexuality in his romantic comedies.

For those who prefer an uplifting and inspirational story about overcoming adversity and achieving success, Restoration may be a better fit. This film follows the trials of one man, CK Erwin, who has lost everything in his life including his family as well, well as his will to live. However, when he takes a job as a mechanic at a small Auto Restore shop, he is soon involved with a new ragtag family who needs him every bit as much as he needs them. Especially feisty Samantha Collins, a high school wrestler, who needs a private coach for her last shot at Finals this year.

I would recommend Passion for its exploration of the challenges and rewards of pursuing one's dreams and passions in life. It's also a great introduction to Michael Jai White's unique blend of martial arts action, comedy, and drama in his martial arts film career.

Based on the given list and preferences, I would recommend "The Expendables 2".

This movie follows a group of retired ex-military men who come together for one last mission in order to retrieve their former commanding officer's gold coins. 

During the mission, one member of the team is murdered by two unknown assailants who escape the scene and are never caught. 

After the murder, the remaining members of the team who were present at the scene where the murder occurred come together in an attempt to find out what happened to their former commanding officer's gold coins after they were murdered. 

During the investigation, one member of the team who was present at the scene where the murder occurred comes forward and tells the investigators that he has information that could lead to finding out what happened to their former commanding officer's gold coins after they were murdered. 

Based on this information, the investigators are able to piece together some of what happened to our former commanding officer's gold coins after they were murdered. 

Overall, "The Expendables 2" is an action-packed movie that will keep you on the edge of your seat from start to finish.
